channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: What to expect from Apple’s “Spring Loaded” event on April 20
item.description: This event is mysterious, but we’re confident iPads will figure prominently.

item.title: Comparing the actual US grid to the one predicted 15 years ago
item.description: Demand and carbon emissions are way down, renewables far more common than expected.

item.title: AT&T/Verizon workers’ union urges states to regulate ISPs as utilities
item.description: “Three decades of of industry-driven deregulation have failed us,” union says.

item.title: The very common vaccine ingredient at the center of J&J, AstraZeneca drama
item.description: Adenoviruses are an obvious link, but a puzzling suspect in the dangerous cases.

item.title: Everything we know about Audi’s next electric crossover, the Q4 e-tron
item.description: The Q4 e-tron and Q4 Sportback e-tron share a platform with VW’s ID.4 crossover.

item.title: Fast and Furious 9 drops a new trailer ahead of June 25 release
item.description: First flying cars. Then an endless runway. Then a submarine. Now magnets.

item.title: Verizon, AT&T, and T-Mobile kill their cross-carrier RCS messaging plans
item.description: Carriers reveal they’ve wasted the last 18 months pretending to do an RCS rollout.

item.title: Oculus Quest 2 gets official wireless-VR mode, 120 Hz support via patch
item.description: Vague dates, stern warnings, and Facebook’s aspiration to VR-ize your home office.

item.title: 100 million more IoT devices are exposed—and they won’t be the last
item.description: Name:Wreck flaws in TCP/IP have global implications.

item.title: Mazda’s electric MX-30 goes on sale in the US this fall
item.description: The battery EV MX-30 will be joined in time by a range-extended rotary hybrid.

item.title: Ford’s hands-free answer to GM’s Super Cruise is called BlueCruise
item.description: F-150s and Mustang Mach-Es will receive an OTA update later this year.

item.title: Hawley’s antitrust bill focuses on market cap, ignoring consumers
item.description: “Size itself is not a sign of anticompetitiveness.”

item.title: Dell’s all-new Inspiron laptop lineup includes a new 16-inch model
item.description: New Inspiron lineup includes a 14 2-in-1, and 13-, 14-, 15-, and 16-inch laptops.

item.title: It’s Dave Bautista and pals vs. zombie horde in Army of the Dead
item.description: Zack Snyder returns to his Dawn of the Dead directorial roots.

item.title: It now seems likely that Starliner will not launch crew until early 2022
item.description: The first hurdle for Starliner: Finding an open port on the space station

item.title: Tesla tells customers they’ll have to pay more for solar roof
item.description: One customer under contract told Ars his price rose from $66,000 to $87,000.

item.title: iOS users—and only iOS users—face NSFW content ban on Discord app
item.description: App Store rules seemingly lead to tighter restrictions for Apple users.

item.title: Victory for municipal broadband as Wash. state lawmakers end restrictions
item.description: Proposed law allowing public broadband networks awaits governor’s signature.

item.title: 17th-century pirates might have stashed Middle Eastern coins in New England
item.description: Fans of the Uncharted game series might recognize Henry Every (Avery).

item.title: Today’s best tech deals: Logitech MX Master 3, Eneloop batteries, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has tons of Xbox and PS4 sales and Google Nest device deals.

item.title: Spring Loaded: Apple announces April 20 event
item.description: A new iPad Pro is expected, among other announcements.

item.title: Google is killing “Google Play Movies & TV” on smart TVs
item.description: Smart TV users get pushed to YouTube, other OSes get Google TV or Play Movies.

item.title: Facebook users can now petition oversight board to remove content
item.description: Nineteen-member board had previously only considered restoring removed posts.

item.title: PlayStation 5 game storage will apparently continue to be a nightmare
item.description: Five months later, “cold storage” isn’t good enough for PS5 game installs.

item.title: Polestar expands the Polestar 2 lineup, adds a single-motor variant
item.description: An optional heat pump will increase the range further, by up to 10 percent.

item.title: J&J COVID vaccine use paused due to one-in-a-million complication
item.description: An extremely rare clotting problem that’s also seen with the AstraZeneca vaccine.

item.title: Roku’s latest streaming device gives 4K, HDR, and a voice remote for $40
item.description: Plus new Roku OS updates and a revised two-in-one streaming soundbar.

item.title: Microsoft makes the Surface Laptop 4 official, offers choice of AMD or Intel
item.description: Newest Surface PC offers familiar hardware but a wider range of configurations.

item.title: The era of reusability in space has begun
item.description: “We’re on the cusp of some bigger initiatives.”

item.title: This is Intel’s plan to dominate driverless car technology
item.description: Intel says its driverless tech will be ready in 2023—I’m skeptical.

item.title: New wooden satellite is part advertising, part student project
item.description: A CubeSat with plywood sides is planned for a Rocketlab launch.

item.title: Report: Apple plans Apple TV/HomePod and iPad/HomePod hybrid products
item.description: Also: Mini LED display supply might make the new iPad Pro hard to find.

item.title: Free Software Foundation and RMS issue statements on Stallman’s return
item.description: Today, Stallman and the FSF board issued joint statements concerning his return.

item.title: It’s too late for vaccines to save Michigan, CDC director explains
item.description: Vaccines take weeks to work; distancing and other health measures work immediately.

item.title: Microsoft acquires Nuance—makers of Dragon speech rec—for $16 billion
item.description: Nuance’s deep-learning-based speech recognition serves 77% of US hospitals.

item.title: Charter must pay $19 million for tricking customers into switching ISPs
item.description: Charter mailed false ads to convince users Windstream was going out of business.

item.title: Archaeologists find “lost golden city” buried under sand for 3,400 years
item.description: It’s the “second most important archaeological discovery since the tomb of Tutankhamun.”

item.title: How long can Epic afford to throw money at the Epic Games Store?
item.description: Exclusives and free games drive massive losses, but it’s just a drop in the Epic bucket.

item.title: Google is killing the Google Shopping app
item.description: In a few weeks, the Shopping tab on Google.com will be the main interface.

item.title: Six decades after Gagarin, nostalgia—and not much else—fuels Russia in space
item.description: “Looking at the Earth from afar, you realize it is too small for conflict.”

item.title: France bans air travel that could be done by train in under 2.5 hours
item.description: France has a well-developed train network, and the ban only affects five routes.

item.title: The Rolls-Royce Ghost: A magic carpet ride that costs as much as a house
item.description: Whether you’re driving or a passenger, there’s no escaping the sense of occasion.

item.title: Review: Our fave gunslinger expels her inner demons in Wynonna Earp finale
item.description: Shine on, you lovable hard-drinking, bar brawling, foul-mouthed anti-Buffy.

item.title: Ecological impacts of solar geoengineering are highly uncertain
item.description: New research describes the unknowns in our knowledge of solar geoengineering.

item.title: A new documentary highlights the visionary behind space settlement
item.description: “I see before us two basic choices.”

item.title: More lightning in the Arctic is bad news for the planet
item.description: Lightning strikes in the far north could double by 2100.

item.title: Voyagers explores complexities of coming of age in space
item.description: Director Neil Burger discusses how his film delves into the core of human nature

item.title: Lego has a new 2,354-piece NASA Space Shuttle set, and it’s awesome
item.description: The toymaker has had space shuttle sets in the past, but none as detailed as this.

item.title: Court rules grocery store’s inaccessible website isn’t an ADA violation
item.description: The Winn-Dixie website isn’t accessible for blind users with screen readers.

item.title: Diablo II Resurrected impressions: Unholy cow, man
item.description: Blizzard Classic follows WarCraft III’s utter failure with an udder success.

item.title: Variant hunters race to find new strains where variant testing lags
item.description: Scientists across Africa are collaborating to track them down.
